column: How would you frame the Accord, so donors see a locally led, sustainable solution—not a short-term project “win”?
prompt_hint: How would you frame the Accord, so donors see a locally led, sustainable solution—not a short-term project “win”?

column: What concrete asks would you make to shift resources directly (and simply) to parish groups while protecting community control?
prompt_hint: What concrete asks would you make to shift resources directly (and simply) to parish groups while protecting community control?

column: When donors push for visibility or speed, how would you negotiate pacing and optics without compromising non-negotiables?
prompt_hint: When donors push for visibility or speed, how would you negotiate pacing and optics without compromising non-negotiables?

column: After a late attempt to weaken local voice (exclusivity/app-only/non-voting), how would you re-engage donors to reinforce equity clauses?
prompt_hint: After a late attempt to weaken local voice (exclusivity/app-only/non-voting), how would you re-engage donors to reinforce equity clauses?

column: Map the most influential actors in this scenario; who do you approach first and why?
prompt_hint: Map the most influential actors in this scenario; who do you approach first and why?

column: What behind-the-scenes steps would you take with skeptics (brokers, shellers, officials) before going public?
prompt_hint: What behind-the-scenes steps would you take with skeptics (brokers, shellers, officials) before going public?

column: How would you anticipate and manage spoilers (rival councillors, election-season restrictions) while retaining access to decision rooms?
prompt_hint: How would you anticipate and manage spoilers (rival councillors, election-season restrictions) while retaining access to decision rooms?

column: What signals would trigger you to update the power map, and how would that change your engagement plan?
prompt_hint: What signals would trigger you to update the power map, and how would that change your engagement plan?

column: In public fora, how will you ensure farmer representatives (women, youth, PWD) are the primary voices?
prompt_hint: In public fora, how will you ensure farmer representatives (women, youth, PWD) are the primary voices?

column: How will you structure media/donor interactions so credit stays local and CARE remains in a background support role?
prompt_hint: How will you structure media/donor interactions so credit stays local and CARE remains in a background support role?

column: What coaching or prep would you provide to local spokespeople to handle tough questions?
prompt_hint: What coaching or prep would you provide to local spokespeople to handle tough questions?

column: If pressured for CARE to front the effort, how would you respond while preserving local ownership?
prompt_hint: If pressured for CARE to front the effort, how would you respond while preserving local ownership?

column: What light-touch governance would you set up to balance inclusion and decisiveness?
prompt_hint: What light-touch governance would you set up to balance inclusion and decisiveness?

column: How would you guarantee meaningful participation (not tokenism) for women, youth, and PWD?
prompt_hint: How would you guarantee meaningful participation (not tokenism) for women, youth, and PWD?

column: What norms/tools would you use to document decisions and share minutes transparently across the coalition?
prompt_hint: What norms/tools would you use to document decisions and share minutes transparently across the coalition?

column: If conflict emerges inside the coalition, how do you resolve it without losing momentum on the Accord?
prompt_hint: If conflict emerges inside the coalition, how do you resolve it without losing momentum on the Accord?

column: How would you co-create Lusoga talking points that make sense to farmers, buyers, and local leaders at the same time?
prompt_hint: How would you co-create Lusoga talking points that make sense to farmers, buyers, and local leaders at the same time?

column: Which themes (dignity, safety, predictability, fair weighing) would you elevate for each audience, and why?
prompt_hint: Which themes (dignity, safety, predictability, fair weighing) would you elevate for each audience, and why?

column: With elections approaching, how would you keep the tone neutral yet persuasive?
prompt_hint: With elections approaching, how would you keep the tone neutral yet persuasive?

column: What specific channels would you use to reach marginalized groups (e.g., youth shellers, PWD) and close the rumor gaps?
prompt_hint: What specific channels would you use to reach marginalized groups (e.g., youth shellers, PWD) and close the rumor gaps?

column: What local data would you prioritize collecting, and how would you verify it?
prompt_hint: What local data would you prioritize collecting, and how would you verify it?

column: How would you ensure informed consent (opt-in in Lusoga, easy withdrawal) and ethical data handling?
prompt_hint: How would you ensure informed consent (opt-in in Lusoga, easy withdrawal) and ethical data handling?

column: How would you package evidence for different rooms (LC3, community, donors) without releasing raw notes to the media?
prompt_hint: How would you package evidence for different rooms (LC3, community, donors) without releasing raw notes to the media?

column: If the coalition’s evidence is challenged, how would you validate methods and protect sources?
prompt_hint: If the coalition’s evidence is challenged, how would you validate methods and protect sources?

column: Without formal authority, how would you secure LC3 agenda time for farmer reps and ACTIVE MINDS?
prompt_hint: Without formal authority, how would you secure LC3 agenda time for farmer reps and ACTIVE MINDS?

column: What backstage diplomacy can CARE do that doesn’t eclipse local leaders?
prompt_hint: What backstage diplomacy can CARE do that doesn’t eclipse local leaders?

column: How would you build trust with cautious officials (e.g., police limits on gatherings) to keep pathways open?
prompt_hint: How would you build trust with cautious officials (e.g., police limits on gatherings) to keep pathways open?

column: If access to LC3 is blocked, what alternative influence routes would you pursue (co-chairs, neutral venues, phased dialogues)?
prompt_hint: If access to LC3 is blocked, what alternative influence routes would you pursue (co-chairs, neutral venues, phased dialogues)?

column: What’s your top five risk register for this context, and how will you monitor each item?
prompt_hint: What’s your top five risk register for this context, and how will you monitor each item?

column: What practical safeguards (consent scripts, small meetings, safe wording) will you put in place for women and youth?
prompt_hint: What practical safeguards (consent scripts, small meetings, safe wording) will you put in place for women and youth?

column: How will you run rapid local feedback loops (e.g., priest’s Lusoga voice notes, “you said / we did” updates)?
prompt_hint: How will you run rapid local feedback loops (e.g., priest’s Lusoga voice notes, “you said / we did” updates)?

column: If political or donor pressure threatens non-negotiables, how will you adapt communications while holding the red lines?
prompt_hint: If political or donor pressure threatens non-negotiables, how will you adapt communications while holding the red lines?
